page.title: 02ECOLOGY
page.content: Most of the land here is flat. It was once under the sea. That is why it is fertile. The soil is mainly silty loam over clay. The climate is good. The flat land is mostly divided into fields with hedges of hawthorn, brambles,holly,hornbeam,oak and other trees. Most of the trees are windswept. Rabbits,hares,foxes,weasels,grey squirrels,mice and rats,moles, pheasants,plover,lapwing and barn owls are all a common sight. About a third of the area is a harbour which is a nature reserve. It is mostly mud flats at low tide. Birds come looking for food. There is very little pollution from the sea but swans have been killed by sewage coming in.
